project.name: Linio Print numbers challenge
project.description:
Write a program that prints all the numbers from 1 to 100. However, for multiples of 3, instead of the number, print "Linio". For multiples of 5 print "IT". For numbers which are multiples of both 3 and 5, print "Linianos".
But here's the catch: you can use only one `if`. No multiple branches, ternary operators or `else`.
# Requirements * 1 if * You can't use `else`, `else if` or ternary * Unit tests * Feel free to apply your SOLID knowledge * You can write the challenge in any language you want. Here at Linio we are big fans of Java, PHP, Kotlin and TypeScript
